Nouse Playlist

With her Diamond Jubilee fast approaching, what better way to celebrate than a celebration of precious gemstones.

Local Spotlight: Tomorrow We Radio

Tomorrow We Radio cite bands such as Hundred Reasons and Kids in Glass Houses as their influences, in turn creating radio friendly rock music with big choruses and catchy hooks.

Review: GZA

GZA play to an angry crowd in the O2 Academy, Sheffield.

Review: James V McMorrow

James V McMorrow showcases his beautiful voice, if not his physical appearance, to a packed out Plug.

Local Spotlight: Ambulance

Ambulance are a refreshingly different outfit plying their trade across our fair cities music venues and across the York university campus.

Interview: Napalm Death

Frontman Barney Greenway talks to Ally Swadling about their latest album, angry music and frustrated thoughts.

Interview: DJ Shadow

Spheres, shadows and creating 'instrumental Hip Hop': Rory Foster is told all by the veteran DJ

Review: Slow Club

Slow Club's 2011 is again brought to a close with their traditional show in Islington's beautiful Union Chapel.

Review: Yuck

"Who are you going to see? Yuck?" My gran doesn't get it

An Alternative Christmas

...if the sight of Justin Bieber is enough to make you want to renounce your alliance to the Yuletide holiday, here are some alternative Christmas songs. (Thumbnail credit Photo Credit: DeskDJ)

Interview: Electric Six

Dick by name and by nature? Dick Valentine talks to Ally Swadling about being rock n roll and 'the Gay Bar band'

Local Spotlight: Miaow Miaow

A quick peruse of the songs available on home grown York-based Miaow Miaow's myspace shows a band with enough musical diversity in four songs to cover several bands' entire discographies...

Starting Over

Business or Pleasure? <em>Alex Edgerton</em> muses on reforming

Joker

The Bristolian prince of dubstep left his doubters silenced with an electric show supported by Royce Rolls

James Blake

What he lacks in stage presence James Blake tries to make up for in bass

The Festive Fanatic's Events Guide

Feast your eyes on some of the best music featuring around the UK this Yuletide...

Constellations Festival 2011 Review

By James Bithell

Constellations festival, now in its second year, is back in neighbouring Leeds University Student Union.

Future Sounds: Jonti

A blend of woozy loops and layers of sickly-sweet production make an impressive, if exhausting, listen. (Thumbnail credit Jonti)

Smashing Pumpkins

Corgan's voice in recent years has often veered into a nasally whine that spoils some of the Pumpkins' older songs, tonight it sounds as ethereal as it did on those early albums. (Thumbnail credit Photo credit: Andra Veraat)

The Good, The Bad, and The Queen

The Good, The Bad, and The Queen differs from your run of the mill supergroup. (Thumbnail credit The Good The Bad and The Queen)

Interview: obLong

obLong tell Ally Swadling about bourbon, dogs and trying to be the worlds greatest

Emmy the Great

Emma-Lee Moss is notoriously penickety. Interviews often betray a persistent character, contesting definitions, questioning questions, and assuring you've got every last bit of info she has to give. This interview wasn't a whole lot different

Ben Howard

Against the bespangled cosmos of the Brudenell Social Club, Ben Howard played and sang his heart out to an enthralled intimate gathering for what was a truly memorable evening.

Laura Marling

"Don't tell the others - but this one's the biggest", Marling whispers mid-set. At the peak of a national cathedral tour, the sounds of her latest top 5 album, "A Creature I Don't Know" booming around the intricate stained glass cavern that is the Minster, this certainly represents a career milestone for the folk songstress who released her first EP at 17

Pocktoberfest Competition

Win two tickets to see Billy Bragg, Seth Lakeman and others

The Nouse Fresher's playlist

<em>No one likes students, not even students. Enjoy your interim as society's most hated with this congratulatory playlist.</em>

Hello Sadness my old friend

Los Campesinos! frontman Gareth tells Sam Briggs about their fourth album <em> Hello Sadness</em>

Paradise Vendors: An Interview with Male Bonding

Male bonding give Adam Bychawski tour tips

Review: Onslaught

It's been a long journey for thrash titans Onslaught, disbanding in 1991, reforming in 2004 and turning over a vast amount of band members and facial hair.

Beth Jeans

Beth Jeans Houghton, a 21-year-old guitarist and singer-songwriter from Newcastle, played the Duchess early October to a small but appreciative crowd: composed in no small part of friends of Houghton and the support acts though also containing a few clearly rapt BJH devotees
